titles.title: Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week” (fols. 2ra-204vb) I-1) Eve of Palm Sunday (fols. 2ra-4va) I-2) Palm Sunday (fols. 4va-11vb) I-3) Monday (fols. 11vb-34vb), including: Homily by John Chrysostom for Monday morning (fols. 19vb-20vc); Homily by John Chrysostom on the fig tree for Monday morning (fols. 20vc-24vc); anonymous Homily for the ninth hour of Monday morning (fols. 30va-32ra) I-4) Tuesday (fols. 34vb-58va) I-5) Wednesday (fols. 58va-74ra) I-6) Thursday (fols. 74ra-98ra) I-7) Friday (fols. 98ra-174rc), including: Homily by John [Chrysostom] on Christ when He says “If it be possible, let this chalice pass” (fols. 104rb-107vc); Homily by Jacob of Serug on Abraham (fols. 133va-142va); Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 170va-173vc) I-8) Saturday (fols. 174rc-204vb), including: Raʾǝyä Yoḥannǝs “Revelation of John” (fols. 178va-192rc); Tǝmhǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat “Teaching of Mysteries” (fols. 201rc-202vc)
Additio 1; colophon.

donors.donor: The name of the original commissioner has been erased from the supplication formulas. However, on fol. 120ra and in the colophon, his name can still be decipherable as Wäldä Giyorgis. In the supplication formula on fol. 42ra, the first part of his name (Wäldä) has not been erased; the same, on some folios (e.g., fols. 42va, 42vc), where the last letter of his second name (-s) still remains. In some supplication formulas his name has been replaced with the name of Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus (e.g., fols. 2ra, 5rb, 13vb, 57ra), written in red probably in a different hand. Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus is the baptismal name of däğğazmač Subagadis (1770-1831). In the supplication formula on fol. 42ra, the name Lǝʿul is written over erasure.

dcomments.dcomment: 18th cent. (?) The name of the king has been erased from the colophon.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. was rebound. The leather covering is probably more recent then the boards, on which there are remains of another and more ancient leather. Outer layers of the original leather covering (?) are separated from the boards and loosely placed between the front board and first folio and the back board and the last folio. Most of the fols. are worn and affected by humidity. Stains on several fols. (e.g., fols. 5r, 39r, 71v, 71r, 89v, 90r, 197v, 198r). Holes or tears amended on some fols. (e.g. fols. 37, 53, 54, 70, 100, 143).

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (4 tools were used: double circles, triple line fillet, triple sine wave, cross hatching)

txfolios.txfolio: no. 38 was used twice (II image = 38a); no. 40 is missing (image = 39); missing no. on fol. between 70 and 71 (image = 71a).

squires.squire: I(9; s.l.: 1, stub after 9/fols. 1r-9v) – II፪(8/fols. 10r-17v) – III፫(8/fols. 18r-25v) – IV፬(8/fols. 26r-33r) – V፭(7; s.l. 1, no stub/fols. 34r-39v) – VI፮(8/fols. 41r-48v) – VII፯(8/fols. 49r-56v) – VIII፰(8/fols. 57r-64v) – IX፱(8/fols. 65r-71av) – X፲(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 3/fols. 72r-79v) – XI፲፩(8/fols. 80r-87v) – XII፲፪(8/fols. 88r-95v) – ፲፫XIII፲፫(6/fols. 96r-101v) – XIV፲፬(8/fols. 102r-109v) – XV፲፭(8/fols. 110r-117v) – XVI፲፮(8/fols. 118r-125v) – XVII፲፯(8/fols. 126r-133v) – XVIII፲፰(8/fols. 134r-141v) – XIX፲፱(8/fols. 142r-149v) – XX፳(8/fols. 150r-157v) – XXI፳፩(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 158r-165v) – XXII፳፪(8/fols. 166r-173v) – XXIII፳፫(8/fols. 174r-181v) – XXIV፳፬(8/fols. 182r-189v) – XXV፳፭(8/fols. 190r-197v) – XXVI፳፮(7; s.l.: 1, stub after 7/fols. 198r-204v).

taunit.ln-info: the number of lines varies from 24 to 28
taunit.rl-info:
Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling (below on fol. 2r). The bottom line is written above the ruling.
One line (or two lines) was not used by the scribe at the bottom of fols. 26r-33v, 49r-52v, 85r-87r, 90r-90v, 92v-93r, 129r-130v.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The handwriting is fine, with rounded and slightly right sloping letters. Some distinctive and/or archaic features: - ጵ has the 6th order marker set up on the vertical stroke at the top, directed to the left (e.g., fols. 2rb l.15, 95ra l.10) - sometimes, the tops of some letters (e.g., መ ሠ ወ በ) are slightly slanted to the left - ፮ is with the loop open, looking like “compressed” ፯ (e.g., fol. 121rc and quire mark on fol. 48v ).

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; name of the commissioner and of the individual replacing him over erasure. A few lines alternating with black lines in the incipit page of Texts I-1 and I-7 (the section for the night hours of Friday); headings and incipits of the texts (a few lines sometimes alternating), their sections and subsections; titles of the Biblical books and other works; directives for the ministers; names of Hebrew letters in Text I-7; the words ʾǝgziʾo täśähalännä, yǝbe, yǝtärägwǝm and yǝbe mätärgwǝm in Text I-7; initial words or letters in “Tǝmḫǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat” (Text I-8). Ethiopic numerals and their elements; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers.

otherdetails.otherdetail: The x-cross with dashes is used several times, after the books titles and the incipits of the hours sections (e.g., fols. 73va, 76vc). Sometimes, the numerals are with several dashes above and below (e.g., fols. 2ra, 90rb, 95vb).

colophon.col: Fol. 204vb (between the explicit of the text and Additio 1): Colophon.
colophon.tran: Fol. 204vb: ዝንቱ: መጽሐፍ፡ ተጽሕፈ፡ በ፳፡ ዓመተ፡ መንግሥቱ፡ ለ<...>። ዘአጽሐፎሂ፡  [ወልደ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡]  ከመ፡ ይኩኖ፡ ለመድኃኒተ፡ …
colophon.det: The name of the king, in whose reign the Ms. was written (in the 20th year of his reign) has been arased as well as the name of the commissioner of the Ms. The name of the latter, however, can be decipherable as Wäldä Giyorgis.

additional.cont: Fol. 204vb (below the colophon): Ownership or donation note (?).
additional.add: Fol. 204vb: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ <...>
additional.det: The note has been for the most part erased. Only the first two words are visible.

extras.extra: - Cues for rubricator (words and numerals) are written in the margins: e.g., fols. 117r, 117v, 121v, 181v, 183r, 192r. - Corrections written over erasures in smaller script, throughout the Ms.: e.g., fols. 8va, 10ra, 10rb, 16ra, 25rb, 88rc. - Erasures marked by thin parallel lines: e.g., 94ra, 105ra, 126rb, 178vc. - Erasures: e.g., fols. 11va, 12ra. - Recent notes in pen are written interlineally and in the bottom margins of some fols.: e.g., fols. 6r, 8r, 121v, 122r, 122v, 131v, 148r, 149v, 150r.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Quires marks (in red or in black, between dashes above and below) are written in the right bottom margin, mostly on the last folio of each quire (except quire I): fol. 17v: ፪; fol. 25v: ፫; fol. 33r: ፬; fol. 39v: ፭; fol. 48v: ፮; fol. 56v: ፯; fol. 64v: ፰; 71av: ፱; fol. 79v: ፲; fol. 87v: ፲፩; fol. 95v: ፲፪; fols. 96r, 101v: ፲፫; fol. 109v: ፲፬; fol. 117v: ፲፭; fol. 125v: ፲፮; fol. 133v: ፲፯; fol. 141v: ፲፰; fol. 149v: ፲፱; fol. 157v: ፳; fol. 165v: ፳፩; fol. 173v: ፳፪; fol. 181v: ፳፫; fol. 189v: ፳፬; fol. 197v: ፳፭.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Cotton thread is inserted in the edge of fol. 178.

frames.frame: Fol. 76ra: simple, small, coloured (red and black) ornamental band; interlaces.
